intro: Paepalanthus nigrescens, commonly known as the black nightshade of the Andes, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking violet to black flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude regions, often in rocky or sandy soils. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and somewhat woody. The species is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its unique appearance.
